title: (x) Macbook Pro pre-unibody silver keyboard - VAG Rounded {Matt V}
content:
What was the typeface used on the pre-unibody Macbook Pro silver keyboards? They stopped using it with the black keys on the unibody models in 2008, and I miss it.

[http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MBP\_keyboard\_closeup.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081722/http:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MBP_keyboard_closeup.JPG "http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MBP\_keyboard\_closeup.JPG")
author: chimerical

comments.content:
chimerical,

If we're on the same page, the typeface you're looking for is [VAG Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081722/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/vag-rounded/). As far as I know, that's still the typeface on all of the unibody "chicklet" keyboards too. I think they started using it some time after Steve Job returned to Apple -- before that their keyboards were set in Univers.

Hmm, you're right. The typeface on the black keys for the unibody models has remained the same.  
 [http://images.apple.com/macbookpro/images/overview-gallery2-20090828.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081722/http:/images.apple.com/macbookpro/images/overview-gallery2-20090828.png "http://images.apple.com/macbookpro/images/overview-gallery2-20090828.png")

I'm probably thinking about the Titanium Powerbook G4 models' black keys, which do seem like Univers.

[http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Apple\_PowerBook\_G4\_Titanium\_close...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081722/http:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Apple_PowerBook_G4_Titanium_close-up_hinge-2006-07-24.jpg "http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Apple\_PowerBook\_G4\_Titanium\_close-up\_hinge-2006-07-24.jpg")  
 [http://www.sfmoma.org/images/artwork/large/2001.397.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130208081722/http:/www.sfmoma.org/images/artwork/large/2001.397.jpg "http://www.sfmoma.org/images/artwork/large/2001.397.jpg")

Thanks for the type ID!
Glad I could help. Most of these I don't know, but I do know my Macs!
